Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

programme.title: Halls of Montezuma
programme.desc: Lieutenant Carl Anderson (Richard Widmark) is a former teacher who leads a band of Marines to an island under Japanese control during World War II, intending to capture enemy soldiers and gain information. When a Japanese soldier reveals a cave where his forces are willing to surrender, the Marines arrive there, only to be ambushed and suffer grave casualties. Now Anderson, having lost much of his original team, must summon up enough courage to attack an important rocket base.

programme.title: They Were Expendable
programme.desc: After a demonstration of new PT boats, navy brass are still unconvinced of their viability in combat, leaving Lt. "Rusty" Ryan (John Wayne) frustrated. After the attack on Pearl Harbor, however, Ryan and his buddy Lt. Brickley (Robert Montgomery) are told they can finally take their squadron into battle. The PT boats quickly prove their worth, successfully shooting down Japanese planes, relaying messages between islands, and picking off a multitude of enemy ships.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: A British POW colonel (Alec Guinness) orders his men to build their Japanese captor (Sessue Hayakawa) a railway bridge in the jungle.

programme.title: Flying Leathernecks
programme.desc: Marine pilots in the World War II Pacific gain respect for a squadron major (John Wayne) who never lets up.

programme.title: Halls of Montezuma
programme.desc: Marines (Richard Widmark, Jack Palance, Robert Wagner) in the South Pacific try to capture Japanese who can point them to a rocket base.

programme.title: December 7th
programme.desc: John Ford co-directed this account of the attack on Pearl Harbor, a film long-banned for potential damage to morale.

programme.title: Ellipse Fit by LegXercise-FREE Deluxe Offer for First 300 Callers!
programme.desc: Do you spend too many hours sitting at a desk? Do you have a tough time exercising due to joint pain? Ellipse Fit will strengthen your legs, boost mobility, and improve circulation with low impact leg movement. Order NOW & claim your FREE Bonus!

programme.title: Beauty and the Bandit
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid (Gilbert Roland) and Chico (Martin Garralaga) secure the deed to a woman's ranch.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick was an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible. His simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Murdock to call for Earp's badge when it appears that a crooked gambler got a saloon license by bribing the marshal.

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes investigates when a prize race horse disappears and its trainer dies unnaturally.

programme.title: Thirty Seconds Over Tokyo
programme.desc: Lt. Col. James Doolittle (Spencer Tracy) leads B-25s off the USS Hornet's deck on a 1942 mission to bomb Japan.

programme.title: They Were Expendable
programme.desc: Heroic PT boat captains (Robert Montgomery, John Wayne) fight Japanese ships in the World War II Philippines.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: A British POW colonel (Alec Guinness) orders his men to build their Japanese captor (Sessue Hayakawa) a railway bridge in the jungle.

programme.title: From Here to Eternity
programme.desc: At an Army barracks in Hawaii in the days preceding the attack on Pearl Harbor, lone-wolf soldier and boxing champion Prew Prewitt (Montgomery Clift) refuses to box, preferring to play the bugle instead. Hard-hearted Capt. Holmes (Philip Ober) subjects Prew to a grueling series of punishments while, unknown to Holmes, the gruff but fair Sgt. Warden (Burt Lancaster) engages in a clandestine affair with the captain's mistreated wife (Deborah Kerr).

programme.title: Sands of Iwo Jima
programme.desc: Marine Sgt. John Stryker (John Wayne) is despised by his own men for his rough attitude and exhausting training regimen. As the war in the Pacific progresses, though, they begin to respect Stryker's hard-edged outlook on war and his brutal training methods, as it has helped them prepare for the harsh realities of the battlefield. They'll need all of Stryker's battle tactics if they want to survive what will end up being one of the bloodiest engagements of the war: the Battle of Iwo Jima.

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny
programme.desc: During World War II, a dilapidated vessel, the Caine, gets a new ensign, Willis Keith (Robert Francis), and a new captain, Commander Queeg (Humphrey Bogart). The crew sees Queeg's unconventional behavior as irrational, and communications officer Thomas Keefer (Fred MacMurray) spreads suspicion about his suitability as captain. When a dire situation during a storm forces the executive officer (Van Johnson) to relieve Queeg of his duties, he and Ensign Keith are tried for mutiny.

programme.title: The Man in the Iron Mask
programme.desc: Tyrannical King Louis XIV (Louis Hayward) learns that he has an identical twin brother, Philippe (also Hayward), who was raised from birth by his late father's trusted friend D'Artagnan (Warren William) and his faithful musketeers, Porthos, Athos and Aramis. After Philippe falls for the king's betrothed, Spanish Princess Maria Theresa (Joan Bennett), Louis imprisons him, forcing his brother to don an iron mask that will slowly suffocate him -- and it's up to D'Artagnan to rescue him.

programme.title: Panhandle
programme.desc: John Sands (Rod Cameron), a reformed outlaw living in a small Mexican town, learns that his brother has been killed in the Texas Panhandle, and he sets out to investigate. When he arrives, he's confronted by a trio of gunslingers working for Matt Garson (Reed Hadley), a local gambler and saloon owner. He also begins to court June O'Carroll (Anne Gwynne), Garson's secretary. John soon grows to believe Garson is responsible for his brother's death, leading to a final showdown.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick was an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible. His simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Earp closes down an all-girl show when the underpaid women begin stealing from the audience, earning Earp the ire of the show's owner, who plots revenge.

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A murder investigation leads Holmes and Watson on a wild goose chase.

programme.title: From Here to Eternity
programme.desc: At an Army barracks in Hawaii in the days preceding the attack on Pearl Harbor, lone-wolf soldier and boxing champion Prew Prewitt (Montgomery Clift) refuses to box, preferring to play the bugle instead. Hard-hearted Capt. Holmes (Philip Ober) subjects Prew to a grueling series of punishments while, unknown to Holmes, the gruff but fair Sgt. Warden (Burt Lancaster) engages in a clandestine affair with the captain's mistreated wife (Deborah Kerr).

programme.title: Sands of Iwo Jima
programme.desc: Marine Sgt. John Stryker (John Wayne) is despised by his own men for his rough attitude and exhausting training regimen. They'll need all of Stryker's battle tactics if they want to survive what will end up being one of the bloodiest engagements of the war: the Battle of Iwo Jima.

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny
programme.desc: During World War II, a dilapidated vessel, the Caine, gets a new ensign, Willis Keith (Robert Francis), and a new captain, Commander Queeg (Humphrey Bogart). The crew sees Queeg's unconventional behavior as irrational, and communications officer Thomas Keefer (Fred MacMurray) spreads suspicion about his suitability as captain. When a dire situation during a storm forces the executive officer (Van Johnson) to relieve Queeg of his duties, he and Ensign Keith are tried for mutiny.

programme.title: The Texas Rangers
programme.desc: The Civil War has ended, the Union Army has pulled out, and now the Texas Rangers are needed once again to protect their state from harm. The newly reformed Rangers decide to take a chance by hiring a notorious outlaw Johnny Carver (George Montgomery). They offer the desperado amnesty for his previous crimes if he'll put his famous trigger finger to work for Texas. Carver agrees, but his new job won't be easy, as his old rival, the Sundance Kid (Ian MacDonald), is out for vengeance.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: Three brothers become outlaws after the Civil War, while a fourth sibling goes to work for the railroad.

programme.title: Hellcats of the Navy
programme.desc: Captain Casey Abbott (Ronald Reagan) commands an American submarine in the Pacific during World War II. When a perilous mission to retrieve a new Japanese mine for study goes awry, he's forced to abandon a likable combat diver, Wes Barton (Harry Lauter). Abbott's orders to leave a man behind appear to be justified, but his second in command, Don Landon (Arthur Franz), believes he had ulterior motives: Barton had been competing for the attention of his love interest, Helen (Nancy Davis).

programme.title: Casanova Brown
programme.desc: Casanova Brown (Gary Cooper) is about to marry Madge (Anita Louise) when he learns that his former wife, Isabel (Teresa Wright), has just had a baby that belongs to him, and plans to put the child up for adoption. Casanova runs out on the wedding, disguises himself as a doctor, visits the hospital where his infant daughter is being held and runs off with her to a hotel, where he does his best to care for the baby. Before long, Madge and Isabel hunt down Casanova, whom they are both furious with.

programme.title: Sea Devils
programme.desc: A smuggler (Rock Hudson) ferries a fake countess (Yvonne De Carlo) to France, unaware she's spying on Napoleon for the British.

programme.title: Movie
programme.desc: The Durango kid aims to break up Pop Ryland's gang of bank robbers but ends up saving the outlaw's son Tommy Ryland who has been marked for death.

programme.title: Bells of Rosarita
programme.desc: Shortly after circus owner Sue Farnum (Dale Evans), her assistant, Gabby (George "Gabby" Hayes), and her late father's ex-partner, Slim Phillips (Addison Richards), accidentally interrupt the filming of a movie starring singing cowboy Roy Rogers (Roy Rogers), Slim is kidnapped. Sue suspects that William Ripley (Grant Withers), a crooked businessman who's trying to steal her circus, is behind the kidnapping. While Sue and Gabby set up a special performance, Roy tracks Slim's kidnappers.

programme.title: Paid Programming
programme.desc: Paid programming.

programme.title: Cattle Queen of Montana
programme.desc: When defiant female rancher Sierra Nevada Jones (Barbara Stanwyck) sweeps into Montana, she receives a hostile welcome from a tribe of Native Americans who attack her cattle and leave her father dead. Kindly Indian brave Colorados (Lance Fuller) and government officer Farrell (Ronald Reagan) help Sierra fight for her land against treacherous locals like the envious Tom McCord (Gene Evans), a neighboring rancher determined to cheat Jones out of her property and drive her back to Texas.

programme.desc: Marines (Tony Curtis, Frank Lovejoy) work with a planter's daughter (Mary Murphy) who knows about Japanese minefields in the Solomon Islands.

programme.title: Bringing Up Baby
programme.desc: A paleontologist (Cary Grant) loses a dinosaur bone to a dog whose heiress owner (Katharine Hepburn) also has a pet leopard, called Baby.

programme.title: Father's Little Dividend
programme.desc: Father (Spencer Tracy) hears Daughter (Elizabeth Taylor) is pregnant in this sequel to Father of the Bride.

programme.title: Laramie Mountains
programme.desc: The Durango Kid learns that crooked scouts are behind attempts to escalate a war between a local tribe and the cavalry.

programme.title: South of the Rio Grande
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid (Duncan Renaldo) and Pancho (Martin Garralaga) catch a district official shooting Mexican ranchers.

programme.title: Cattle Queen of Montana
programme.desc: An Army agent (Ronald Reagan) rides with a Texan (Barbara Stanwyck) trying to drive her father's cattle through rough territory.

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: A Wyoming rancher's (Ernest Borgnine) wife eyes a drifter (Glenn Ford), and her ex-lover (Rod Steiger) tells her husband.

programme.title: The First Time
programme.desc: A young married couple, Joe (Robert Cummings) and Betsey Bennet (Barbara Hale), are parents-to-be, expecting their first child. When the day arrives, the two frantically race to the hospital -- even smashing into a few trash cans along the way. With the delivery a success, Joe and Betsey get to discover what it's truly like being parents, beginning with the hospital bill. As the demands on their patience, wallets and time increase, Joe and Betsey are on the edge and close to falling off.

programme.title: Run Silent, Run Deep
programme.desc: After Japanese forces torpedo his submarine during World War II, commanding officer "Rich" Richardson (Clark Gable) is placed in charge of the USS Nerka. The crew on board the Nerka -- led by Lieutenant Jim Bledsoe (Burt Lancaster), who had been passed over for promotion when Richardson was brought in -- is openly hostile to their new commander, especially when it becomes clear that Richardson's sole obsession is finding and destroying the Japanese ship that sank his old vessel.

programme.title: Gasoline Alley
programme.desc: A black-sheep cousin of Corky's wife causes nothing but trouble for the Wallet family, as they try to devise a way to send him packing.

programme.title: My Dear Secretary
programme.desc: When romance writer Owen Waterbury (Kirk Douglas) meets Stephanie Steve Gaylord (Laraine Day), he offers her a job as his secretary. Steve, a would-be writer herself, accepts the position but is quickly dismayed by Owen's shabby work ethic and distracting visitors, including Ronnie (Keenan Wynn), his rowdy, mischievous neighbor. Despite their differing outlooks, Owen and Steve get married, but artistic and romantic jealousy just might tear them apart.

programme.title: The Last Horseman
programme.desc: A ranch foreman (Russell Hayden) and his buddies pose as women to get the jump on outlaws.

programme.title: The Son of Davy Crockett
programme.desc: President Ulysses S. Grant enlists a frontiersman's son to help insure the inclusion of Texas into the Union.

programme.title: In Old New Mexico
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid (Duncan Renaldo) and Pancho (Martin Garralaga) free a girl (Gwen Kenyon) accused of murder, then find the killer.

programme.title: Gasoline Alley
programme.desc: A black-sheep cousin of Corky's wife causes nothing but trouble for the Wallet family, as they try to devise a way to send him packing.

programme.title: The First Time
programme.desc: A young married couple, Joe (Robert Cummings) and Betsey Bennet (Barbara Hale), are parents-to-be, expecting their first child. When the day arrives, the two frantically race to the hospital -- even smashing into a few trash cans along the way. With the delivery a success, Joe and Betsey get to discover what it's truly like being parents, beginning with the hospital bill. As the demands on their patience, wallets and time increase, Joe and Betsey are on the edge and close to falling off.

programme.title: EZ WELL Massage System - Relax, Restore, Rejuvenate -Full-Body Relief!
programme.desc: Experience the Remedy Massage System! Feel weightless and remove pressure points with zero gravity memory foam while vibration, infrared heat, and deep tissue massage work to soothe aches, boost circulation, and relax your body. Unwind & recharge!

programme.title: Remedios Caseros
programme.desc: Remedios naturales y fáciles para afrontar diferentes condiciones crónicas o degenerativos y enseñar al maneo del un nuevo estilo de vida.

programme.desc: Programa infantil que imparte principios y valores para educar el carácter de los pequeños, se incluyen alabanzas, historias de la Biblia, juegos y aprendizaje de destrezas.

programme.title: Amiguitos de Jesús
programme.desc: Valores morales y espirituales que ayudará a los niños a cultivar un mejor carácter.

programme.desc: La lucha entre el periódico y el canal de noticias es permanente, cada uno trabaja duro por conseguir la primicia. A la cabeza del diario, Américo Baigorria trata de poner paz entre sus propios empleados.

programme.title: Respuestas Bíblicas
programme.desc: Principios, sabiduría y explicaciones contenidos en el libro sagrado, espacio abierto a las preguntas e inquietudes del público.

programme.title: Salvación en señales y símbolos
programme.desc: El pastor Carlos Muñoz, el doctor Héctor Delgado y su panel explican de forma sencilla el mensaje, los secretos y el lenguaje.

programme.title: Afirmaciones de Fe
programme.desc: Reflexiones sobre la Escritura de inspiración divina, qué enseña, qué advierte y cómo ayuda a vivir en la fe y la armonía.

programme.desc: Respondiendo a preguntas e inquietudes sobre diversos temas de interés actual de forma abierta al diálogo.

programme.title: A Time to Kill
programme.desc: (1996) Adults-only thriller with Samuel L Jackson and Matthew McConaughey. When a man's daughter is raped, he takes lethal revenge. Can an inexperienced lawyer save him?

programme.title: Pig
programme.desc: (2021) Thriller. Nicolas Cage delivers a subtle turn in Michael Sarnoski's debut, an intriguing tale of an off-the-grid truffle hunter who returns to the city to rescue his kidnapped pig.

programme.title: Orphans
programme.desc: (1998) Peter Mullan's comedy drama starring Douglas Henshaw. A hard-drinking Glaswegian family gather to bury their mother, but it's going to be a stormy ride on many levels.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Faintheart
programme.desc: (2008) Comedy with Eddie Marsan and Jessica Hynes. A husband who's obsessed with Viking re-enactments must decide whether his heart lies with his hobby or winning back his estranged wife.

programme.title: The Sheriff of Fractured Jaw
programme.desc: (1959) Comedy western with Kenneth More. An English gunsmith decides the Wild West is the best market for his wares, but little does he expect to end up sheriff of a lawless frontier town.

programme.title: Nicholas Nickleby
programme.desc: (1947) Drama with Derek Bond, based on Charles Dickens' novel. After his father dies, Nicholas seeks the help of his cold, avaricious, scheming uncle. Predictably, it doesn't go well.

programme.title: Gideon of Scotland Yard
programme.desc: (1958) Drama. Jack Hawkins stars as Police Inspector Gideon, who faces outrage and danger in his quest to bring London's criminals to justice. With Anna Massey, John Loder and Cyril Cusack.

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: (2008) Remake of the sci-fi classic with Keanu Reeves. An alien visits Earth to tell humankind to stop destroying the planet. But when he's attacked, he decides to eradicate us instead...

programme.title: Bloodshot
programme.desc: (2020) Vin Diesel stars in this action-packed superhero adventure. After he and his wife are killed, a US soldier is brought back to life and given superhuman powers.

programme.title: Rocketman
programme.desc: (2019) Taron Egerton is Elton John in Dexter Fletcher's sequins-and-all biopic musical drama. With Jamie Bell as lyricist Bernie Taupin and Stephen Graham as Dick James.

programme.title: Corsage
programme.desc: (2022) Marie Kreutzer's tightly corseted biographical drama starring Vicky Krieps as a quietly defiant Empress Elisabeth of Austria as she turns 40 on Christmas Eve 1877. In German/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Picnic
programme.desc: (1955) William Holden and Kim Novak star in this sweltering tale of deception, betrayal and illicit love in small-town Kansas.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: (1954) Judy Holliday stars in this comedy as a smalltown girl who comes to New York and rents a billboard to publicise her name - and soon she's a TV star. With Jack Lemmon.

programme.title: Far from the Madding Crowd
programme.desc: (1967) Julie Christie and Terence Stamp star in John Schlesinger's adaptation of Thomas Hardy's novel. Bathsheba is not short of suitors, but will marrying any of them lead to happiness?

programme.title: The Remains of the Day
programme.desc: (1993) Anthony Hopkins stars in this subtle drama about the dedicated butler of a post-WWI home whose loyalties are tested when the housekeeper (Emma Thompson) falls in love with him.

programme.title: Beast
programme.desc: (2022) Thrilling romp starring Idris Elba as an all-action doctor who must protect his family from a man-slaying lion in the wilds of South Africa, armed with a jeep and a keen right hook.

programme.title: Monday
programme.desc: (2020) Romcom-cum-romtradge about what can happen when a steamy holiday fling morphs into something more permanent. And it ain't necessarily good. Starring Sebastian Stan and Denise Gough.

programme.title: Friends with Benefits
programme.desc: (2011) Romcom. Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis star as friends who aren't fans of romance. But they do like sex. Can they really sleep together but avoid all that emotion?

programme.title: Broken Arrow
programme.desc: (1950) Western starring James Stewart. A gold prospector, tired of reprisal killings between whites and Native Americans, offers a truce to the Apaches' leader. But tensions resurface.

programme.title: Storm over the Nile
programme.desc: (1955) Drama. Anthony Steel stars as a disgraced soldier who, during the British army's 1898 campaign in Sudan, goes way beyond the call of duty to prove his courage. With Laurence Harvey.

programme.title: 13 Rue Madeleine
programme.desc: (1947) WWII drama. James Cagney stars as the tough US secret agent overseeing a special mission to discover the location of the factory where the Nazis are manufacturing their flying bombs.

programme.title: The Land that Time Forgot
programme.desc: (1974) Fantasy adventure about survivors from a torpedoed First World War ship who end up in a legendary land in the Atlantic where dinosaurs roam. With Doug McClure.

programme.title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle
programme.desc: (2017) Fantasy adventure sequel with Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black. Four teenagers are sucked into the Jumanji video game to complete a dangerous quest.

programme.title: Reality
programme.desc: (2023) Tina Satter's tense fact-based whistleblower drama stars Sydney Sweeney (White Lotus) as Reality Winner - a young woman being questioned by the FBI about leaked top-secret documents.

programme.title: Man on Fire
programme.desc: (2004) Revenge thriller with Denzel Washington. An ex-CIA agent who's trying to start a new life in Mexico seeks brutal retribution when the girl who he's been hired to guard is kidnapped.

programme.title: Dead Presidents
programme.desc: (1995) Crime drama set in the Bronx of the 70s, starring Larenz Tate. To support his young family, a Vietnam veteran is driven to take part in the daring robbery of an armoured truck.

programme.title: My Classic Car
programme.desc: My Classic Car is a weekly television program that captures America's Love affair with the automobile! Dennis Gage, the handlebar mustachioed host, takes you along for the ride and keeps it entertaining with his unique perspective and enthusiasm for all things automotive. This show has something for everyone. From daily-drivers to Dusenberg's - from local cruise-ins to the most prestigious car shows in the world, this program covers it all!

programme.title: Longevity With David Rubenstein

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Emily Chang meets Melinda French Gates in Seattle to discuss how she's navigating her next stage as a philanthropist and investor.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Emily Chang meets Salesforce Co-Founder and CEO Marc Benioff to discuss the rise of AI agents and what it's like to run a global tech company.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Asia Trade
programme.desc: Bringing global investors everything you need to know as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders.

programme.title: Bloomberg: The China Show
programme.desc: From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors insight into the world's second-biggest economy, delivering in-depth discussions with newsmakers.

programme.title: Insight with Haslinda Amin
programme.desc: In a volatile and unpredictable world, the show will be the definitive guide for the global news audience to get the complete picture on the biggest story of the day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East & Africa
programme.desc: A spotlight on the fast paced growth and major deals happening across the Middle East and Africa, linking the market drivers from overnight in the U.S. and across Asia into the region's trading day, with deep-dive analysis of the top businesses.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe
programme.desc: From London, essential morning viewing to stay ahead of the day's market trends with news stories from the U.S. and Asia in the lead-up to the opening of European markets.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Opening Trade
programme.desc: "The Opening Trade" explores things to know as markets open across Europe; analysis that isn't available anywhere else, a break down of the biggest stories of the day and top guests who have skin in the game.

programme.title: The Pulse with Francine Lacqua
programme.desc: Based in London, Francine Lacqua speaks with guests about global business, economics, finance and politics.

programme.title: Bloomberg Brief
programme.desc: "Bloomberg Brief" delivers the market news, data and analysis viewers need to set their agendas.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance
programme.desc: Jonathan, Lisa and Annmarie survey the economy and global markets with daily conversations with leaders and decision makers, from Wall Street to Washington and beyond, to cover the latest in business, investment and geopolitics.

programme.title: Bloomberg Open Interest
programme.desc: Delivering the market-moving news anyone needs to know to get a jump start on the U.S. trading day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Crypto
programme.desc: The latest news, analysis and interviews covering the people, transactions and technology shaping the world of decentralized finance.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets
programme.desc: The most important global business and breaking markets news and information as it happens.

programme.title: Bloomberg: Balance of Power
programme.desc: Focusing on the intersection of politics and global business.

programme.title: Bloomberg Businessweek Daily
programme.desc: Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec bring reporting from the magazine that helps global leaders stay ahead, plus insight on the people, companies and trends shaping today's complex economy.

programme.title: Bloomberg: The Close
programme.desc: Alix Steel, Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu own the market-moving breaking news around the closing bell; a synthesis of the top stories; key insights from investors, strategists and the companies of today and tomorrow.

programme.title: Bloomberg: Balance of Power

programme.desc: A healthy appetite and a willing palate are essential traits for fans of "MeatEater." From hunting turkey in Florida and elk in Kentucky, to grizzlies in British Columbia and antelope in New Mexico, avid outdoorsman, author and TV personality Steven Rinella pursues a wide variety of prey during thrill-ride, challenging adventures. programme.title: Wake Up America Weekend

programme.title: The Big Trees
programme.desc: A timber baron plans to take advantage of a new law and make millions. Making his money turns out to be harder than he ever thought when the Quakers who own the land refuse to sell their precious trees.

programme.title: The Gatling Gun
programme.desc: An Apache warrior chief is willing to offer gold, and even sacrifice some of his men, to get his hands on Richard J. Gatling's powerful invention. It's up to a cavalry lieutenant, his scout, and a tough rancher to end the chief's deadly ambition.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E12 Song of Isiah Isiah Burke and his wife Rosemary are abolitionists who are trying to lead a group to freedom. Jimmy, who is visiting his sister, becomes involved with them but soon finds out that their tactics are too violent.

programme.title: High Lonesome
programme.desc: A sudden and swift series of murders occurs in southwestern Texas, sending Big Bend country into a frenzy. All parties are suspicious of a young rambler who just moved to the area, believing his presence must be related to the crimes.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E8 Miss Milly A young, naïve woman who doesn't have any business experience comes to North Fork and purchases the general store from Hattie Denton. A newcomer and his partner con her by posing as collection agents, putting the town's citizens in danger.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E15 Suspicion Lucas and Mark find Winslow Quince stranded in the desert with a broken wagon wheel. They stop to help, and when they get to North Fork with Quince, many note his gold coin purchases and lavish gifts. Lucas is suspicious, and townsfolk want answers.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E16 The Sidewinder Gridley Maule comes to North Fork with revenge on his mind and confronts Lucas, who shot and killed his father years ago during a bank robbery. When Gridley tries to get Mark to fight, Micah puts him in jail, and Lou steps in to reform the young boy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E17 The Sixteenth Cousin The big day finally arrives in North Fork as the first train comes to town. Onboard are Lucas and Mark along with a Japanese nobleman and his servant. When bullies harass the foreign visitors, the pair quickly teaches them a lesson in good manners.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E18 Hostages to Fortune On Halloween, Mark and his friends wear masks and go from ranch to ranch to play pranks. Knowing the boys will be blamed, rustlers wear similar masks to steal cattle. Lucas thinks the boys are mixed up in the theft, until he finds out the truth.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E1 Bubba, Cody and Booger: Back in the Saddle Back for a new season of riding horses and roping cows, cowboy trio Bubba, Cody and Booger undertake a huge cattle drive for Cody's brother in-law in Mississippi. Bubba and Kaley wager a bet on who can better handle the other's workload: Bubba tries his hand at babysitting while Kaley does Bubba's ranch chores. Misty wants to be a stay-at-home mom, but suffers an accident while trying to help Cody on the farm. As Booger and his girlfriend Jaclyn get more serious, Booger considers taking their relationship one step further.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E2 Put a Ring on It When an infection threatens the herd, Bubba, Cody and Booger have to act fast. They enlist the help of young veterinary student Dakota to doctor the cows and keep the virus from spreading. Cody helps Misty take the first step towards starting her cattle business. The cowboys decide to build an office for the company, but Bubba throws a wrench into the plan when he's called to Mississippi to visit Kaley's parents. Bubba's in-laws pressure him to take a hard look at his future while Booger works up the nerve to pop the question and start a future with Jaclyn.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E39 The Mind Reader Rancher John Hallager is shot and killed in North Fork and young Billy Mathis is a prime suspect. Billy was seeing Hallager's daughter but was told to stay away. Lucas believes in Billy's innocence, and a clue may help.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E8 Ordeal Lucas and Mark travel through the desert to get a supply of salt when a rattlesnake spooks their horses, causing the wagon to overturn. A horse must be put down due to injury and Lucas is also badly hurt. Mark has no choice but to go for help alone.

programme.title: The Big Trees
programme.desc: A timber baron plans to take advantage of a new law and make millions. Making his money turns out to be harder than he ever thought when the Quakers who own the land refuse to sell their precious trees.

programme.title: The Gatling Gun
programme.desc: An Apache warrior chief is willing to offer gold, and even sacrifice some of his men, to get his hands on Richard J. Gatling's powerful invention. It's up to a cavalry lieutenant, his scout, and a tough rancher to end the chief's deadly ambition.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E12 Song of Isiah Isiah Burke and his wife Rosemary are abolitionists who are trying to lead a group to freedom. Jimmy, who is visiting his sister, becomes involved with them but soon finds out that their tactics are too violent.

programme.title: High Lonesome
programme.desc: A sudden and swift series of murders occurs in southwestern Texas, sending Big Bend country into a frenzy. All parties are suspicious of a young rambler who just moved to the area, believing his presence must be related to the crimes.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E8 Miss Milly A young, naïve woman who doesn't have any business experience comes to North Fork and purchases the general store from Hattie Denton. A newcomer and his partner con her by posing as collection agents, putting the town's citizens in danger.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E15 Suspicion Lucas and Mark find Winslow Quince stranded in the desert with a broken wagon wheel. They stop to help, and when they get to North Fork with Quince, many note his gold coin purchases and lavish gifts. Lucas is suspicious, and townsfolk want answers.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E16 The Sidewinder Gridley Maule comes to North Fork with revenge on his mind and confronts Lucas, who shot and killed his father years ago during a bank robbery. When Gridley tries to get Mark to fight, Micah puts him in jail, and Lou steps in to reform the young boy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E17 The Sixteenth Cousin The big day finally arrives in North Fork as the first train comes to town. Onboard are Lucas and Mark along with a Japanese nobleman and his servant. When bullies harass the foreign visitors, the pair quickly teaches them a lesson in good manners.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E18 Hostages to Fortune On Halloween, Mark and his friends wear masks and go from ranch to ranch to play pranks. Knowing the boys will be blamed, rustlers wear similar masks to steal cattle. Lucas thinks the boys are mixed up in the theft, until he finds out the truth.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E3 Tradition vs. Technology A routine job turns tough when the cowboys struggle to wrangle the herd across a highway, sparking Cody's idea to use GPS devices so they can easily find cattle in the pasture. Bubba hides a cow in the woods and Booger challenges Cody to prove GPS technology beats traditional methods. Misty and Kaley help Jaclyn find the perfect wedding dress while Bubba fails to fit into his tuxedo pants, prompting Booger and Cody to put him on a weight-loss regimen. Cody writes a song in honor of Booger's wedding and surprises Misty with a trailer for her new cattle business.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E4 Bulls on the Beach While the cowboys are sorting the herd, Cody suffers a close call on the job that sets off a string of bad luck as he plans his annual rodeo, Bulls on the Beach. He struggles to impress a potential sponsor and the entire event is put in jeopardy when the bulls don't arrive as scheduled. Bubba heads to Mississippi to work for his father-in-law and try his hand at office life. Booger and Jaclyn enjoy learning the first dance for their wedding, but Booger finds himself awkwardly out of place as the only man at their bridal shower!

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E18 The Horse Traders Kansas Sawyer is Lucas' friend who was cheated in a horse-trading deal. Lucas investigates Colonel Bourbon's operation and discovers his illegal process. He also learns that the horse Sawyer bought was stolen and is being sought after by outlaws.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E31 The Jailbird Bessie Steel Weaver welcomes her husband, Farley, home after his release from prison. Lucas hires him as a hand believing he has changed his ways. However, when a murder occurs during a local robbery, suspicions are aroused.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E7 Molly's Choice A young Jim Bridger helps a Shoshone woman escape the clutches of her abusive husband. As Bridger squares off against the frontier ruffian and his henchmen, he soon realizes that the woman he is helping is none other than the legendary Sacajawea.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Snakeroot Cure When a young girl is bitten by a rattlesnake, mountain man Jim Bridger finds himself in a race against time to save her arm and keep her alive as he desperately searches the wilderness for a medicinal plant that once saved the life of his friend.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Dalton Gang Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter and sheriff, is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story behind the most brazen bank robbery of the Old West. Masterson tracks down the sole survivor of the Dalton Gang, who relives the horrible day when they attempted to rob two banks at the same time. The youngest of the Dalton brothers, Emmett Dalton describes how the gang was gunned down as they tried to make their getaway. Despite numerous gunshot wounds, Emmett lived to serve his time in prison and renounce his life of crime.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E3 The Great Train Robbery Bat Masterson, former gunfighter and sheriff, is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the story behind one of the country's greatest train robberies. Although Butch and Sundance are long gone, Masterson tracks down Sundance's former girlfriend, Etta Place, to draw out more details. To pull off the audacious robbery, they used official Union Pacific lanterns to signal the train and fool the engineer into believing a bridge was out. As Etta reluctantly relives the events of the robbery and its aftermath, it's obvious that she is still smitten by Sundance after all of these years.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E2 William Bartram: America's First Great Naturalist Naturalist William Bartram explores the unmapped regions of the South to document the native fauna and flora. After surviving many encounters with Native Americans and wildlife, it's an invisible virus that may finally end the journey and his life.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: S4 E10 The Ultimate All-Star In the final cattle drive of the season, the three remaining cowboys have one last chance to prove they deserve to be the Ultimate Cowboy All-Star Champion. Host Trace Adkins and the expert judges evaluate each cowboy's skills and determine a winner.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E13 Spies The Kid befriends a young woman named Margaret, who unbeknownst to him, is a charming spy. His kindness toward her results in him and the other riders becoming involved in an elaborate scheme to steal a gold shipment.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E13 Star in the Dust During his travels, Cheyenne arrives in a small town and quickly befriends the local sheriff. However, he soon finds himself caught up with a pretty young woman, as well as a stash of stolen money, which jeopardizes his new friendship.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E14 Johnny Bravo A wealthy rancher hires Cheyenne as a ranch foreman. Shortly after he begins his duties, his friend falls in love with the boss' beautiful daughter. However, the rancher has other plans, as his sights are set on Cheyenne to become his new son-in-law.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E19 And the Devil Makes Five While returning from a hunting trip, Lucas and Mark meet Marshal Micah Torrance who is escorting prisoner Scully Potter to trial. Later in camp, Lucas' life is suddenly in danger when a rattlesnake is found in his bedroll. Potter tries to escape.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E20 End of the Hunt Lucas wants to kill an old enemy, Reef Jackson, who is coming to North Fork. In the past, Jackson shot Lucas in the back and tried to steal his wife. Micah puts Lucas in jail to stop him from getting his revenge. Meanwhile, Mark wants to bag an elk.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E21 The Bullet While traveling, Lucas rescues a man named Griff, a corrupt gambling hall owner. When he reports Griff to the marshal, Lucas learns that a missing friend of his is dead and the marshal is using a new science called ballistics to solve the crime.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E22 Requiem at Mission Springs Mark is paralyzed after falling off his horse. When Doc Burrage suggests that warm mineral baths could help him recover, Lucas and Lou take Mark to the old Mission Springs. However, danger lies ahead when escapees arrive.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E31 Outlaw's Shoes Lucas rides to a nearby town to see the gunsmith to get a new spring for his rifle. On the way, two gunmen ambush Lucas, knocking him unconscious. When Lucas awakens, he has amnesia and thinks he is one of the outlaws, George Vale, who is wanted.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E21 The Bullet While traveling, Lucas rescues a man named Griff, a corrupt gambling hall owner. When he reports Griff to the marshal, Lucas learns that a missing friend of his is dead and the marshal is using a new science called ballistics to solve the crime.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E22 Requiem at Mission Springs Mark is paralyzed after falling off his horse. When Doc Burrage suggests that warm mineral baths could help him recover, Lucas and Lou take Mark to the old Mission Springs. However, danger lies ahead when escapees arrive.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E5 Saddle Up or Settle Down? Bubba, Cody, and Booger have their work cut out for them removing a dangerous cow from a local rancher's herd. Bubba continues to shadow his father-in-law, making his first business pitch to a potential client. He begins to realize a life in Mississippi could prove to be very lucrative, but he isn't ready to hang up his spurs just yet. Misty convinces Cody to let her have his ranch horse for her new cattle business, requiring Cody and Booger to train a replacement colt for Cody. Booger and Jaclyn find wedding planning to be more troublesome than they anticipated.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E6 Tying the Knot When a cow goes rogue and plants herself in the middle of a pond, Booger and Cody rely on their roping skills to pull her out. Bubba is feeling pressured to give up the cowboy way of life when he is offered the opportunity to take over the management of his father-in-law's company. Misty attempts to buy cows from a notoriously tough trading-cattle owner, who also happens to be her brother-in-law. Booger and Jaclyn plan the finishing touches for their wedding, and everyone joins together to celebrate their special day.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E3 Seven A prison wagon carrying seven criminals stops in North Fork for supplies. The men escape, barricade themselves in the North Fork Saloon, and take saloon owner, Frank Sweeney, hostage. Lucas must act quickly to save Sweeney and the town from harm.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E10 The Schoolmaster Mr. Griswald is the new North Fork schoolmaster. As a harsh disciplinarian, he quickly clashes with Mark and his friend one too many times. When the boys decide to play hooky from school, they find big trouble when they get trapped in an old mine.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E9 The Prizefighter When Jim Bridger's second-in-command begins enforcing camp discipline with brutal violence, one trapper pushes back, and a showdown seems inevitable. Can Bridger intervene before the situation turns from mutual hostility into cold-blooded murder?

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E10 A Shard of Glass Haunted by the memory of leaving a man to die, mountain man Jim Bridger is determined not to repeat the mistake. When his trapping party runs out of water while crossing a barren desert, Bridger struggles desperately to keep his companions alive.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Legend of the Blue-Eyed Apache When eleven-year-old Herman Lehmann is torn away from his frontier home by an Apache raiding party, he must adapt in order to survive. He soon forgets the life he unwillingly left behind and is adopted by an Apache family. For close to a decade, he lives as a Native American, learning their language and customs. Eventually, he even joins the same type of raiding party that separated him from his family. Though the years pass by, Herman's mother never gives up hope that she will be reunited with her son. One day, she hears a rumor of a blue-eyed Apache now living on a reservation. Could this be her long-lost son? Some years later, Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, interviews Herman's mother to uncover the real story of the blue-eyed Apache.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E5 The Real Lone Star Ranger When young Texas Ranger Ira Aten is having trouble hunting down a ruthless outlaw, he enlists the help of John Hughes, an aloof rancher with an uncanny talent for tracking bad guys. The two men form an unlikely and unexpected bond while traversing the dusty path toward justice. With Hughes' guidance, Aten finally catches up to the outlaw and ends his reign of terror. Along the way, Hughes decides to become a Ranger himself and transforms from loner to lawman. Hughes' adventure with Aten is just the first chapter of a storied career that inspires the popular novel, The Lone Star Ranger. Some years later, Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, interviews Aten years later to uncover the real story of the Lone Star Ranger and separate the truth from the fiction.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E3 Daniel Boone: Cunning Woodsman Legendary frontiersman Daniel Boone faces the biggest challenge of his life when the Shawnee take him prisoner. He must find a way to escape and travel 160 miles through hostile territory to warn Boonesborough, and his family, of a looming attack.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Nels Stack Story Nels Stack, a war veteran, joins the wagon train. He is now a pacifist who defends against any prejudice. Stack's mild manner leads others to label him a coward. But the tides turn when his kindness gets the train out of dangerous Indian territory.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E14 Shadowmen A Pinkerton agent comes to Rock Creek in search of a bank robber. Meanwhile, Teaspoon befriends Marie, who claims to be destitute, but Bill and Jesse discover that she is part of an outlaw gang.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E15 The Last Train West Cheyenne is on the run from the law after being falsely accused of murder. He boards a west-bound train for California, but a reverend's daughter interrupts his plans when she threatens to turn him in.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E1 The Dark Rider Swindled by a charming woman, Cheyenne soon tracks her down as she drives her herd of cattle to Kansas. He joins the drive and finds out that one of the wranglers is a murderer.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E23 The Guest A charming man named Mario Rosati arrives at the McCain Ranch and introduces himself as an acquaintance of an old family friend. Lucas and Mark offer him a place to stay for a few days, but they learn that he has an ulterior motive: to kill Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E24 Old Man Running An old man named Sam Gibbs comes to North Fork in need of Marshal Micah Torrance's protection from criminals who are after him. Sam happens to be Mark's grandfather and Lucas' deceased wife's father. Lucas finds peace with his past and helps Sam.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E25 Which Way'd They Go? The Jackman clan must sell their farm to pay back taxes. The Jackmans were not much at farming so they move to a nearby town and take jobs as peace officers. When bank robbers confront them, Lucas must step in and help them deal with the outlaws.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E26 Old Tony Old Tony, an irritable old recluse, has a reputation in North Fork as being a mean hermit. When Mark and his girlfriend, Lorrie, look for arrowheads on his land, they become trapped in quicksand. Tony shows his good-hearted nature and rescues them.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E19 A Young Man's Fancy A pretty young girl named Sally Walker arrives on stagecoach in North Fork to visit her aunt Milly. When Mark sees her beauty, he falls in love with Sally instantly. However, she has her eyes on a boy from her past, Bruce Henry, who owns a ranch.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E5 Saddle Up or Settle Down? Bubba, Cody, and Booger have their work cut out for them removing a dangerous cow from a local rancher's herd. Bubba continues to shadow his father-in-law, making his first business pitch to a potential client. He begins to realize a life in Mississippi could prove to be very lucrative, but he isn't ready to hang up his spurs just yet. Misty convinces Cody to let her have his ranch horse for her new cattle business, requiring Cody and Booger to train a replacement colt for Cody. Booger and Jaclyn find wedding planning to be more troublesome than they anticipated.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E6 Tying the Knot When a cow goes rogue and plants herself in the middle of a pond, Booger and Cody rely on their roping skills to pull her out. Bubba is feeling pressured to give up the cowboy way of life when he is offered the opportunity to take over the management of his father-in-law's company. Misty attempts to buy cows from a notoriously tough trading-cattle owner, who also happens to be her brother-in-law. Booger and Jaclyn plan the finishing touches for their wedding, and everyone joins together to celebrate their special day.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E3 Seven A prison wagon carrying seven criminals stops in North Fork for supplies. The men escape, barricade themselves in the North Fork Saloon, and take saloon owner, Frank Sweeney, hostage. Lucas must act quickly to save Sweeney and the town from harm.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E10 The Schoolmaster Mr. Griswald is the new North Fork schoolmaster. As a harsh disciplinarian, he quickly clashes with Mark and his friend one too many times. When the boys decide to play hooky from school, they find big trouble when they get trapped in an old mine.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E9 The Prizefighter When Jim Bridger's second-in-command begins enforcing camp discipline with brutal violence, one trapper pushes back, and a showdown seems inevitable. Can Bridger intervene before the situation turns from mutual hostility into cold-blooded murder?

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E10 A Shard of Glass Haunted by the memory of leaving a man to die, mountain man Jim Bridger is determined not to repeat the mistake. When his trapping party runs out of water while crossing a barren desert, Bridger struggles desperately to keep his companions alive.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Legend of the Blue-Eyed Apache When eleven-year-old Herman Lehmann is torn away from his frontier home by an Apache raiding party, he must adapt in order to survive. He soon forgets the life he unwillingly left behind and is adopted by an Apache family. For close to a decade, he lives as a Native American, learning their language and customs. Eventually, he even joins the same type of raiding party that separated him from his family. Though the years pass by, Herman's mother never gives up hope that she will be reunited with her son. One day, she hears a rumor of a blue-eyed Apache now living on a reservation. Could this be her long-lost son? Some years later, Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, interviews Herman's mother to uncover the real story of the blue-eyed Apache.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E5 The Real Lone Star Ranger When young Texas Ranger Ira Aten is having trouble hunting down a ruthless outlaw, he enlists the help of John Hughes, an aloof rancher with an uncanny talent for tracking bad guys. The two men form an unlikely and unexpected bond while traversing the dusty path toward justice. With Hughes' guidance, Aten finally catches up to the outlaw and ends his reign of terror. Along the way, Hughes decides to become a Ranger himself and transforms from loner to lawman. Hughes' adventure with Aten is just the first chapter of a storied career that inspires the popular novel, The Lone Star Ranger. Some years later, Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, interviews Aten years later to uncover the real story of the Lone Star Ranger and separate the truth from the fiction.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E3 Daniel Boone: Cunning Woodsman Legendary frontiersman Daniel Boone faces the biggest challenge of his life when the Shawnee take him prisoner. He must find a way to escape and travel 160 miles through hostile territory to warn Boonesborough, and his family, of a looming attack.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Nels Stack Story Nels Stack, a war veteran, joins the wagon train. He is now a pacifist who defends against any prejudice. Stack's mild manner leads others to label him a coward. But the tides turn when his kindness gets the train out of dangerous Indian territory.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E14 Shadowmen A Pinkerton agent comes to Rock Creek in search of a bank robber. Meanwhile, Teaspoon befriends Marie, who claims to be destitute, but Bill and Jesse discover that she is part of an outlaw gang.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E15 The Last Train West Cheyenne is on the run from the law after being falsely accused of murder. He boards a west-bound train for California, but a reverend's daughter interrupts his plans when she threatens to turn him in.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E1 The Dark Rider Swindled by a charming woman, Cheyenne soon tracks her down as she drives her herd of cattle to Kansas. He joins the drive and finds out that one of the wranglers is a murderer.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E23 The Guest A charming man named Mario Rosati arrives at the McCain Ranch and introduces himself as an acquaintance of an old family friend. Lucas and Mark offer him a place to stay for a few days, but they learn that he has an ulterior motive: to kill Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E24 Old Man Running An old man named Sam Gibbs comes to North Fork in need of Marshal Micah Torrance's protection from criminals who are after him. Sam happens to be Mark's grandfather and Lucas' deceased wife's father. Lucas finds peace with his past and helps Sam.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E25 Which Way'd They Go? The Jackman clan must sell their farm to pay back taxes. The Jackmans were not much at farming so they move to a nearby town and take jobs as peace officers. When bank robbers confront them, Lucas must step in and help them deal with the outlaws.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E26 Old Tony Old Tony, an irritable old recluse, has a reputation in North Fork as being a mean hermit. When Mark and his girlfriend, Lorrie, look for arrowheads on his land, they become trapped in quicksand. Tony shows his good-hearted nature and rescues them.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E7 All for One or One for Himself Booger and Jaclyn enjoy a romantic beach getaway for their honeymoon and discuss their new life together. Misty and Cody contemplate a business partnership. To celebrate their anniversary, Bubba and Kaley take a trip to Mississippi, and Bubba begins to warm up to the idea of relocating there permanently to work with Kaley's father. However, Bubba's reluctance to tell Booger and Cody about the job offer from his father-in-law causes tensions to boil over, leaving the future of their business, and their friendship, uncertain.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E8 Happy Trails Booger and Cody struggle to pen two bulls in need of a veterinary check-up. Cody gets soaked when he fails to heed Booger's prediction of a rainstorm, sparking Booger to try his hand at delivering the local weather forecast. Bubba decides to accept the job with his father-in-law in Mississippi and he makes a handmade gift for Cody and Booger to soften the blow when he breaks the news to them. The trio takes on one last big job to benefit a neighbor in need. Bubba and Kaley host a final cookout before they pack up and leave for Mississippi.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E18 The Actress A dying friend of Lucas McCain's asks him to go to a nearby town to bring back his wife, Elizabeth, so he can see her one last time. Lucas agrees but is surprised to find a beautiful, young actress who is not interested in grieving over her husband.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E3 Sheer Terror Lucas stands guard at the North Fork Bank when $50,000 arrives in a specially designed stagecoach strongbox. Two gunmem who plan to ambush and rob the stage take Milly and Mark hostage in the general store, which doubles as their headquarters.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E1 They Killed Me Frontiersman Jim Bridger spins an incredible tale to a group of settlers, claiming he was once killed by Blackfeet warriors yet somehow lived to tell the tale. They think he's joking, but Bridger soon proves that he really did rise from the dead.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E4 Brothers in Arms When they are ambushed by a Blackfeet war party, Jim Bridger and a lone Shoshone brave must work together to find a way to defeat their common enemy. If they can't overcome their suspicions and learn to trust each other, they may not survive the day.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E6 Bass Reeves: Trailblazing Lawman After escaping the bonds of slavery, Bass Reeves takes refuge among the indigenous people of The Indian Territory, where he is welcomed into their culture. When the Civil War ends, his new-found tracking skills and fluency in native languages lead to his appointment as the first Black Deputy U.S. Marshal west of the Mississippi River. Though he faces discrimination from his peers, Reeves earns their respect when he accepts Judge Isaac Parker's daunting order to hunt down one of the most ruthless killers in The Indian Territory and bring him back dead or alive. Some years later, Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, interviews Judge Parker to learn more about the amazing career of Bass Reeves, who goes on to arrest 3,000 felons, kill 14 men in self-defense, and complete 32 years of service without being wounded.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E7 Wild Bill Hickok & the First Quick-Draw Duel Wild Bill Hickok and his buddy, Davis Tutt, see their friendship fall apart over gambling debts and the affections of a beautiful woman. After Tutt swipes Wild Bill's prized timepiece as payback for a disputed debt, things begin to heat up. Then, when Tutt parades through town with the watch in one hand and Hickok's former girlfriend in the other, Wild Bill's blood begins to boil. Tutt refuses to return the watch, and he continues to flaunt the beautiful woman on his arm. The two men meet in the middle of town to settle their differences once and for all in what will become the very first quick-draw duel of the Old West. Both men reach for their pistols at the same time and fire! In an attempt to separate the truth from the fiction, Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, interviews George Ward Nichols, the journalist who immortalized the duel and created the legend of Wild Bill Hickok.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E1 Joe Meek: A Fearless Fighter Already a seasoned mountain man, Joe Meek has a reputation for raw courage and bravery among the trappers of the west. But Meek becomes a frontier legend when he risks his life in a fearless charge to save the woman that he loves from Crow warriors.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Annie MacGregor Story While on the trail, Annie MacGregor and her Scottish family's wagon wheel breaks. The family patriarch doesn't want any help until Major Adams' wagon train stops. Conflict arises when they practice their traditions, including playing bagpipes.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E15 Mask of Fear After serving his time in prison, a murderer returns to Rock Creek. Meanwhile, Jesse has a new boss in Fury, who he looks up to as a father figure. But, the murder of his boss leads Jesse and the townspeople quick to blame the town's new arrival.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E2 The Long Winter Cheyenne waits out a long winter with a herd in the northern mountains during a cattle drive. Trouble arises as he finds himself not only dealing with the conditions, but feuding trail hands, a mule, Christmas, and love.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E3 Death Deals the Hand Cheyenne teams up with old Hoot Hollister, who is planning to marry his girlfriend, on a riverboat trip to St. Louis. While aboard, things begin to unravel when they entangle with a teacher and crooked gamblers.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Sharpshooter Lucas McCain and his son, Mark, arrive in North Fork to purchase a ranch. When Lucas enters a turkey shoot to win money for a down payment, he soon finds himself at odds with town villain Jim Lewis.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E2 Home Ranch After Lucas buys his ranch, hired hands of a wealthy cattleman demand he leave. When Lucas refuses, the men beat him, drag him, and then they burn his ranch house to the ground. Lucas tracks these men down and confronts their boss, Oat Jackford.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E3 End of a Young Gun A young outlaw named Will Fulton saves Mark's life but breaks a leg in the process. He mends at Lucas' ranch, and there meets the lovely Ann Bard. The outlaw begins to soften and reassesses his choices and path in life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Marshal Micah Torrance, formerly a famous marshal, who is now a drunk crippled from a gunfight, stumbles into North Fork. Lucas McCain hires him in hopes of rehabilitating the man. The good deed quickly backfires when outlaws arrive.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Sharpshooter Lucas McCain and his son, Mark, arrive in North Fork to purchase a ranch. When Lucas enters a turkey shoot to win money for a down payment, he soon finds himself at odds with town villain Jim Lewis.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E2 Home Ranch After Lucas buys his ranch, hired hands of a wealthy cattleman demand he leave. When Lucas refuses, the men beat him, drag him, and then they burn his ranch house to the ground. Lucas tracks these men down and confronts their boss, Oat Jackford.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E3 End of a Young Gun A young outlaw named Will Fulton saves Mark's life but breaks a leg in the process. He mends at Lucas' ranch, and there meets the lovely Ann Bard. The outlaw begins to soften and reassesses his choices and path in life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Marshal Micah Torrance, formerly a famous marshal, who is now a drunk crippled from a gunfight, stumbles into North Fork. Lucas McCain hires him in hopes of rehabilitating the man. The good deed quickly backfires when outlaws arrive.

programme.title: The Legend of 5 Mile Cave
programme.desc: A boy enchanted with tales from the Old West unlocks a mystery that could save their family farm. While his widowed mother struggles to avoid foreclosure, a mysterious stranger arrives looking for a room to rent. A bond with the boy grows as the drifter recounts breathtaking stories of Shooter Green, a legendary gunslinger accused of Arizona's biggest gold robbery. The truth is revealed, along with the secret of the drifter's past when a crooked lawman appears, hot on the trail of the stolen gold. Past and present collide in this tale of action, adventure and drama. Stars Adam Baldwin (The Last Ship, Full Metal Jacket, The Patriot), Jeremy Sumpter (Peter Pan, Soul Surfer), Jill Wagner (Braven, Christmas Cookies), and Jet Jurgensmeyer (Last Man Standing, American Sniper).

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E13 A Friend in Need A man named Carl Avery kidnaps Mark and demands a $5,000 ransom for his safe return. Lucas mortgages his ranch to a longtime friend for the money. When Lucas delivers the ransom, he discovers his friend is part of the disturbing kidnapping plot.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E22 Deadly Image A local rancher, who claims to be an eyewitness, accuses Lucas of murder. Townspeople are shocked until Earl Bantry, who looks like Lucas' twin, arrives in North Fork. Bantry, a ruthless criminal, threatens Mark and goes on a rampage against Lucas.

programme.title: Legends of the Pony Express
programme.desc: Heroic Pony Express riders and station keepers face deadly terrain, hostile Native Americans, and dangerous outlaws to deliver vital mail across the untamed frontier. Their life-and-death adventures unite the country and become the stuff of legends.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E8 Dr. Susan Anderson: Frontier Medicine Woman Freshly-graduated from medical school, Dr. Susan Anderson sets up a practice in Cripple Creek, Colorado, a rough-and-tumble mining town. At a time when only ten percent of physicians are female, Dr. Anderson faces her share of doubters and has a difficult time attracting patients in the frontier town. When miners suddenly rush into her office with an injured boy, she defies prevailing wisdom and decides to save his mangled arm instead of amputating the limb. The risks are enormous. If the boy's arm becomes infected, and he dies, she will lose everything. Years later, Dr. Anderson relives the story while treating Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, who comes down with fever while passing through Cripple Creek.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E9 Elfego Baca & the Frisco Shootout Just days on the job and brandishing a homemade badge, nineteen-year-old Deputy Elfego Baca's courage is immediately put to the test. After arresting a drunken cowboy for shooting up a saloon, Baca faces down the cowboy's friends, who are hired guns for a wealthy rancher. He wins the first skirmish, but the cowboys return with reinforcements and the stage is set for the biggest and longest gunfight in Old West history. Baca seeks shelter in a small adobe house and makes his stand against a small army of men who shoot up the house with thousands of rounds of ammunition over the course of 33 hours. Years later, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson gets the real story of what comes to be known as the Frisco Shootout from the former sheriff who deputized Baca just prior to the legendary gun battle.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E2 Jim Beckwourth: The Long Ride Jim Beckwourth lives a life of adventure as a trapper, trader and adopted member of the Crow tribe. When America goes to war, Beckwourth becomes an army dispatch rider, a job that puts him and a young greenhorn on a collision course with the Pawnee.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: S2 E1 The Flint McCullough Story Flint returns home to Fort Bridger to visit the man who raised him. A run-in with an enemy brings back painful memories of his time in the Confederate Army and the tragedy that ensued after falling in love with Jean Yates, a young Mormon.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E1 They Killed Me Frontiersman Jim Bridger spins an incredible tale to a group of settlers, claiming he was once killed by Blackfeet warriors yet somehow lived to tell the tale. They think he's joking, but Bridger soon proves that he really did rise from the dead.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E4 Brothers in Arms When they are ambushed by a Blackfeet war party, Jim Bridger and a lone Shoshone brave must work together to find a way to defeat their common enemy. If they can't overcome their suspicions and learn to trust each other, they may not survive the day.

programme.title: Vengeance Valley
programme.desc: A Colorado rancher contends with his two sons, one biological and the other adopted, who are fighting over control of the massive family property. Which brother will come out on top in this family battle for cash and cattle?

programme.title: The Quick and the Dead
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger crosses paths with a frontier family traveling to the Wyoming Territory. He becomes the family's defender against a ruthless gang bent on taking all they have and robbing them of their dreams, lives, and futures.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E3 The Blowout Al Walker, a sick gunslinger, comes to North Fork hoping to die in peace. Knowing that his presence will attract outlaws, Micah and Lucas put him in protective custody. When outlaws set fire to the town, Walker dies a hero by standing up to them.

programme.title: The Legend of 5 Mile Cave

While his widowed mother struggles to avoid foreclosure, a mysterious stranger arrives looking for a room to rent. Past and present collide in this tale of action, adventure and drama. programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E4 Brothers in Arms When they are ambushed by a Blackfeet war party, Jim Bridger and a lone Shoshone brave must work together to find a way to defeat their common enemy. If they can't overcome their suspicions and learn to trust each other, they may not survive the day.

programme.title: Think Big
programme.desc: Children are the future -- and so are their inventions, which is why "Think Big" could be an important show. It features young inventors competing to see who can come up with the most-innovative invention. Each episode features two teams in the Think Tank -- a studio filled with art supplies and construction materials -- who brainstorm and choose materials before sketching, designing and building a prototype to be presented to a judge, who determines a winner. The champions earn bragging rights and the coveted Genius Cup.

programme.desc: S2025 Professional snowboarder Danny Kass, winner of two Olympic silver medals and even more Winter X Games bling, teams up with Australian colleague Luke "the Dingo" Trembath for a rollicking sports travel series. If there's fresh powder and a steep incline, chances are these two fun-loving guys and their entourage are speeding there in their customized RV, eagerly awaiting the chance to display their talents. programme.desc: (1967) Julie Christie and Terence Stamp star in John Schlesinger's adaptation of Thomas Hardy's novel. Bathsheba is not short of suitors, but will marrying any of them lead to happiness?

programme.title: The Remains of the Day
programme.desc: (1993) Anthony Hopkins stars in this subtle drama about the dedicated butler of a post-WWI home whose loyalties are tested when the housekeeper (Emma Thompson) falls in love with him.

programme.title: Beast
programme.desc: (2022) Thrilling romp starring Idris Elba as an all-action doctor who must protect his family from a man-slaying lion in the wilds of South Africa, armed with a jeep and a keen right hook.

programme.title: Monday
programme.desc: (2020) Romcom-cum-romtradge about what can happen when a steamy holiday fling morphs into something more permanent. And it ain't necessarily good. Starring Sebastian Stan and Denise Gough.

programme.title: Friends with Benefits
programme.desc: (2011) Romcom. Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis star as friends who aren't fans of romance. But they do like sex. Can they really sleep together but avoid all that emotion?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Broken Arrow
programme.desc: (1950) Western starring James Stewart. A gold prospector, tired of reprisal killings between whites and Native Americans, offers a truce to the Apaches' leader. But tensions resurface.

programme.title: Storm over the Nile
programme.desc: (1955) Drama. Anthony Steel stars as a disgraced soldier who, during the British army's 1898 campaign in Sudan, goes way beyond the call of duty to prove his courage. With Laurence Harvey.

programme.title: 13 Rue Madeleine
programme.desc: (1947) WWII drama. James Cagney stars as the tough US secret agent overseeing a special mission to discover the location of the factory where the Nazis are manufacturing their flying bombs.

programme.title: The Land that Time Forgot
programme.desc: (1974) Fantasy adventure about survivors from a torpedoed First World War ship who end up in a legendary land in the Atlantic where dinosaurs roam. With Doug McClure.

programme.title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle
programme.desc: (2017) Fantasy adventure sequel with Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black. Four teenagers are sucked into the Jumanji video game to complete a dangerous quest.

programme.title: Reality
programme.desc: (2023) Tina Satter's tense fact-based whistleblower drama stars Sydney Sweeney (White Lotus) as Reality Winner - a young woman being questioned by the FBI about leaked top-secret documents.

programme.title: Man on Fire
programme.desc: (2004) Revenge thriller with Denzel Washington. An ex-CIA agent who's trying to start a new life in Mexico seeks brutal retribution when the girl who he's been hired to guard is kidnapped.

programme.title: Dead Presidents
programme.desc: (1995) Crime drama set in the Bronx of the 70s, starring Larenz Tate. To support his young family, a Vietnam veteran is driven to take part in the daring robbery of an armoured truck.
